N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6173.3 - Application procedure

State Regulations
(a) An application for funding pursuant to
this Part shall be in a form and manner prescribed by the commissioner and must
include a plan for the provision of program services to eligible drivers that
addresses, at a minimum: (1)
the nature of
the program services to be rendered; (2)
how the program services comply with
section
6173.6
of this Part; (3)
the cost associated with rendering the
program services; and
(4)
a
description of how the program services will enhance livery vehicle
safety. (b) The
commissioner shall disburse funding pursuant to this Part and shall determine
the amount of funds to be disbursed to a provider agency or agencies within
available appropriations. In awarding funds, the commissioner shall consider
the following factors: (1)
the need for the
program services within the targeted geographical area; (2)
the extent to which the program services
will improve livery vehicle safety; (3)
the nature of the program services to be
rendered; (4)
the ability of the
applicant to effectively implement and administer the program
services; (5)
the qualifications
and relevant experience of the applicant, particularly the applicant's
knowledge of and experience with the operation of livery vehicles; (6)
the cost of the services; and
(7)
the established fiscal controls which
guarantee the proper administration and accounting of program funds. Notes
